subject: Re: [junit] Failed to invoke suite(): java.lang.NullPointerExcept ion
msgSnippet: ... Better: don t use that constructor. Use the default one. (I assume JUnit 3.8.1 or later.) -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> Make sure you're setting the name of the test in the constructor.
> [i.e., Call super(name) in your constructor.]

Better: don't use that constructor. Use the default one. (I assume JUnit
3.8.1 or later.)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
